values:
On February 17 and 18, HDS received more email in two 24 hour spans than ever before.  Have a look:
17 February 2007 | 1602 Bounced 
18 February 2007 | 1698 Bounced 

99% of this was bounced notices, where botnets had imitated my email and used it to spam.  Because my email was my domain's default address, I received all notices, even when the addresses were completely made up (ejwejrh@hisdivineshadow.net for instance).  Examining my cPanel, it looks like the notices are still coming.  I don't know why.  I had to switch my default address to stem the tide.
http://kamikage.livejournal.com/17449.html
... that I post to this as I work on it's more public offspring.  So much spiffier does that one look.  Regardless, this place is more suitable for ... certain topics ... >.>
http://kamikage.livejournal.com/17353.html

I continue to despise university life the more I live it.  All that is good is the dining hall (Yay South!) and the walking I get in from class to class.  'Tis all.

Oh, and I read you postie, Nessles, but have no response.  I would have responded, perhaps, last week, but you had not posted in so long HDS removed ye from his daily check list.
http://kamikage.livejournal.com/16924.html

HDS has had much rage.  Much more rage than in the recent past.  The Savannah trip ebbed the tide, but it seems it took another viewing of The 13th Warrior to bring me back to my usual misanthropic and curmudgeonish self.  Odd, really, seeing as how an upcoming day has always made me nothing but angry.  Of course, the original catalyst for my rage still exists, and rage I do when I see it, but I don't care enough anymore to let it cause further trouble than that.


Also, I am up late again.  What's with that?
http://kamikage.livejournal.com/16825.html

The Three Burials of Melquiades Estrada proved to this one, once again, the amazing things that can happen when a film does not constrain itself within the bounds that Hollywood and the American viewer set for it.  That is all.
http://kamikage.livejournal.com/16521.html

Ong Bak verily entertained.
Yet anger after was preordained.
The rage I feel is more,
Than all the past two years had in store.
Fortunately, I leave the internet for a time,
To rest and repent, perhaps to climb
Out, out of this pit so filled
With rage so cold blood it chilled.
I tire of wanting, I tire of desire.
The Buddha was right, it brings only fire.
I'd close this chapter provided I knew how,
So instead, I'll leave, sans bow.
http://kamikage.livejournal.com/16272.html
Why did HDS wait so long to begin sorting files?  Why!?  I have too many to move ... ;_; *Drowns*  Oh, and nessles disappeared.   Wha happan?
http://kamikage.livejournal.com/16006.html

HDS's loot is nearly done arriving. He today received the complete Shin-Tenchimuyo Laserdisc collection, complete with absolutely tons of art new to HDS and some only seen in inferior (Read: small, JPEG) form. Before this, HDS received the two lovely and exceedingly rare artbooks he also ordered, both of Shin-Tenchimuyo, as well as two artbooks of lesser rarity on Mai-HiME. Now only Hellsing Ultimate Volume 1, limited, and a Last Exile trading figure set remain. It has been a fruitful, if expensive, month, aye aye. XD


Look! The mood is happy kitty! Astounding! XD


Oh, and some more commentary: For those who don't know, HDS keeps an infrequently-utilized Gaia Online account which he decks with goodies. Wandering through Gaia Towns yesterday, I inspired awe from two other users online with the sheer amount of stuff on my avatar. XD In a way, the stuffed avatar represents my own packrattish ways. X3
http://kamikage.livejournal.com/15711.html

... HDS is now a moderator at the TMF.  Do I really act like enough of a role model that such an appointment seems logical?  I never thought so, but apparently the "Goody Two-Shoes" result I received in one of the quizzes on my site is more appropriate than I knew. XD
http://kamikage.livejournal.com/15526.html

Gankutsuou scans that are easily crafted into signatures are sorely lacking.  This upsets this one, as a new signature today I wish to create.


EDIT: Never mind.  HDS found one.
http://kamikage.livejournal.com/15208.html

And here I thought something odd was going on; I'd been feeling downright chipper for most of a week or more now.  Tonight (And yesterday, actually) I have returned to apathy and pseudo-depression (I say pseudo because it is less unhappiness than a generally dreary and melancholy outlook that consumes me, not to be confused with hopelessness or despair.  I have neither because apathy prevents me from ever feeling there is anything I need to bother looking forward to. XD).  All is right with the world!  Ooo, I can use "depressed" as a kitty-emote!  *Wanders off*
http://kamikage.livejournal.com/14878.html

Internal Hard Disk Drives are still too expensive.  Seagate!  Western Digital!  Hitachi!  Someone!  Get new technology introduced so the price on current models can come down!  HDS needs a new storage dump, aye.  

Oh, and don't each three-fourths of a chocolate creme pie in 24 hours.  Imma warnin' ye.
http://kamikage.livejournal.com/14621.html
I am addicted to fanlistings.  That is all.
http://kamikage.livejournal.com/14578.html
I've put it off for so long that I forgot to note it here: HDS released version three of his site.  Nothing special, merely overdue.  Very overdue.
http://kamikage.livejournal.com/14098.html

Just finished the second volume of The Count of Monte Christo but an hour or so ago and lo!, what a piece.  Perhaps I am odd, perhaps I am outside the normal bounds that define society and those within it, but I thoroughly enjoyed every moment of it as I have not since I read Dante's Inferno some weeks ago (I discount a re-reading of Watership Down given that, as noted, it was a re-read).  Rare is it that I feel delight at a book, but Dumas' superb work has stood the viciousness of time and given me a lovely few days (Including volume one, not yet mentioned.) of bliss in the written word.


Oh yes, one more thing.  ATF?  I am watching you.  I see every breath you take.  Every move you make.  Every bond you break.  Every step you take.  I am watching you.  =P
http://kamikage.livejournal.com/13875.html
http://kamikage.livejournal.com/13620.html

...and the number of the counting shall be two. Three shalt thou not count, neither shalt thou count one, excepting that thou then proceedeth to two. Four is right out.

And out of that nonsense springs a lovely fact: All layouts for version three of me website are completely done.  Finished.  Only some additions to one in terms of content and a two pages that need changes on another remain.  Of course, this little bit will probably take me until Christmas. XD

Oh, and soon my Laserdiscs will be on their way.  Yays!
http://kamikage.livejournal.com/13519.html

HDS finds himself...happy.  How can this be?  Well, it is because HDS may have found something he has been seeking for a very long time, namely the Laserdiscs of Shin Tenchimuyo, and specifically the things featuring this image http://www.hisdivineshadow.net/laserdisc/aeka_07.jpg.  I think I'll go explode out of joy somewhere now...
http://kamikage.livejournal.com/13102.html

At long last, the last last layout  is completed.  All that remains is some content creation/shifting before the grand opening (As well as some editing of one of the older layouts).  For the one person who has basically seen all the layouts complete long before I bother to announce the fact, this message marks HDS finally finding a fanlisting management script that actually works.
http://kamikage.livejournal.com/13040.html
...about 1.5 layouts left to go, and the sources for them will soon be arriving to my person, along with much other scannable material.
http://kamikage.livejournal.com/12714.html

Yet again PayPal has refused to do as I say.  Process a simple transaction with no hitches?  Of course not.  Paypal decided to exercise whatever authority is has and not give HDS a choice of which credit card he wanted to charge the transaction to and then picked at random, choosing a card that wasn't even the primary one, and one that I certainly never told it to touch.  What bugs me more is that the info on that card is years old, wrong address even, and the system still happily chugged along, charging it.  If it's that easy, why even bother asking me for billing info?  Doesn't seem to matter much does it, Paypal? *Sigh*
http://kamikage.livejournal.com/12294.html

It seems like all the cheer of yesterday just exploded.  Unhappy tidings at one of my haunts have arisen, and as usual I knew nothing of them beforehand.  This is not necessarily bad that I didn't know, but the suddenness of everything is less than helpful.  As much as I remain apart from the normal social interactions and mechanations of the members of the various places I visit, the loss one who had seemed a most splendid person is outside the norm.  I cannot truly judge, having known and intending to know nothing of what transpired, but the incident cements further my logic for staying to myself as often as possible.   C'est la vie, but unfortunately so.
http://kamikage.livejournal.com/12085.html

What is it with all these LJ posts, eh?  Perhaps as my site revamp nears completion things long forgotten begin to surface again.  Perhaps it is because I've little to do afternoons at the moment.  Perhaps it's just that I'm a post whore.  Probably the latter.

HDS is currently concocting a list of characters for a future thing.  The person who may or may not also be involved in the thing may guess at the thing.  That is all. XD
http://kamikage.livejournal.com/11985.html
HDS is feeling unusually giddy right about now.  Why?  How?  To what end?  It would be frightening if it wasn't so amusing. XD
http://kamikage.livejournal.com/11684.html

HDS finds himself reading a great deal again. In recognition of that, he is posting in this relic for the first time in a while. Bradbury has once again become a great sea upon which I can float, although Kafka, Murakami, Poe, and Nietzsche are on the horizon. I find myself again remembering days long ago listening to cassettes (Yes, cassettes. =P) of The Martian Chronicles as I plow through his works (Something Wicked This Way Comes at the moment.).  A good science fiction romp, one grounded in the classic styles of Bradbury, remains a splendid thing.
http://kamikage.livejournal.com/11339.html
Just in case LJ sends their H-K Bots after those who don't post for long periods of time, here's a post. And, since I've nothing more to say, here's Luffy with breasts.
http://kamikage.livejournal.com/11159.html

'Tis rare I stumble on a gem long forgotten, but the recent rediscovery of Outlaw Star's second end theme (And to a lesser extent its first as well as its opening theme) has unearthed a treasure I'd long since left to dust and forgotten memories.

1. First name? 
Why
2. Were you named after anyone? 
Unlikely
3. When did you last cry? 
Unsure
4. DO YOU LIKE YOUR HANDWRITING? 
'Tis messy, but I hate it no more so than anything else, which is to say deep, burning loathing
5. What is your favorite lunchmeat? 
Unsure
6. Kids? 
No
7. If you were another person, would you be friends with you? 
I'm not friends with anyone, no matter what
8. Do you have a journal? 
This and one other thing, currently in alpha-stage development
9. Do you use sarcasm a lot? 
Perhaps...more along the lines of cynicism
10. Do you still have your tonsils? 
No

No

Crispix

No

Probably not

I dislike ice cream, although I used to enjoy Backin Robbin's Red Raspberry Sorbet

13, US Mens

Neither

Everything

No one

Define "Everyone"

Navy and black, respectively
22. Last thing you ate? 
Taco

Backporch Music on WUNC
24 If you were a crayon, what color would you be? 
The one that was next to invisible on most any color
25. Favorite smell? 
With all the colds I have, smell rarely functions

Father
27. The first thing you notice about people you are attracted to? 
I'm not attracted to people
I stole it from a thief

Water, Orange Juice, Apple Cider, or Milk

I don't do activity

Brown

Brown?
No

Mongolian Chicken without spices

I dislike television/movie media

The Bank

Blue

Winter

Neither

Baklava or Kunafa

We'll see

No idea

Decade of Nightmares

A mouse?

I haven't watched TV in nearly 3/4 of a year

Unsure

I know so little of both

Ixtapa, Mexico.  Alternately, Portland, OR

No

Somewhere in NJ at some time between 12 AM and 11:59 PM

Lets see if I can come back to LJ with some regularity here...I suppose starting with more outright theft from fellow LJers is a fitting return. Oh, and the reason comments were disabled on the last entry was because I didn't feel like dealing with them. XP Not that it stopped many people, eh?
You Are 50% Boyish and 50% Girlish
You are pretty evenly split down the middle - a total eunuch. Okay, kidding about the eunuch part. But you do get along with both sexes. You reject traditional gender roles. However, you don't actively fight them. You're just you. You don't try to be what people expect you to be.
How Boyish or Girlish Are You?
Unsurprising, I'd say.
What type of Fae are you? Hmm.
You Are a Newborn Soul
You are tolerant, accepting, and willing to give anyone a chance. On the flip side, you're easy to read and easily influenced by others. You have a fresh perspective on life, and you can be very creative. Noconformist and nontraditional, you've never met anyone who's like you. Inventive and artistic, you like to be a trendsetter. You have an upbeat spirit and you like almost everything. You make friends easily and often have long standing friendships. Implusive and trusting, you fall in love a little too easily. Souls you are most compatible with: Bright Star Soul and Dreaming Soul
What Kind of Soul Are You?
Doubtful, the truth of this is. But, too lazy to retake, I am.

From the Jayman or Liger. I don't know who had it first. XD 1. How tall are you barefoot? 5'9" with ideal gravity. 2. Have you ever smoked heroin? Noes. 3. Do you own a gun? Hmmm...no. 4. Rehab? Been there? No. 5. Do you get nervous before "meeting the parents"? I would assume no. XD 6. What do you think of hot dogs? Horrifying, yet I keep eating them. I'd stop, but I'm running out of foods that I still eat. 7. What's your favorite Christmas song? I have no idea. 8. What do you prefer to drink in the morning? Orange Juice or milk with an Instant Breakfast. 9. Do you do push-ups? Exercise? Bah. 10. Have you ever done ecstacy? Noes. 11. Are you vegatarian? Doubtful. 12. Do you like painkillers? I dislike medicine in general. We dealt with pain and ailments before they existed. 13. What is your secret weapon to lure in the opposite sex? Why would I need one? I dislike people. 14. Do you own a knife? Hmm...I'd say no. 15. Do you have A.D.D.? Doubtful. 16. Date Of Birth? No sah. 17. Top 3 thoughts at this exact moment: 1) GalCivII 2) My foot is uncomfortable 3) Sticky note...digging...into...hand... 18. Name the last 3 things you have bought? 1) Gas 2) Gas 3) Gas 19. Name five drinks you regularly drink: 1) Water 2) Orange Juice 3) Milk 4) 5) That's all I drink. XD 20. What time did you wake up today? 6:15 AM 21. Current hair? Shortish. 22. Current worry? Me worry? I subscribe to the church of apathy, if such can be subscribed to. 23. Current hate? Everything, everyone, anything else that does not cover, with all things hated equally. 24. Favorite place to be? Dead. IN MY GRAVE. UNDERGROUND. 25. Least favorite place to be? Wherever I am when I'm not dead. 26. Where would you like to go? GRAVE. 27. Do you own slippers? Noes. 28. Where do you think you'll be in 10 yrs?? Dead, if I'm lucky, enlisted in the US Army, or something as yet unseen. 29. Do you burn or tan? I don't go outside. XD 30. Last thing you ate? A piece of pineapple. 31. Would you be a pirate? Too lazy. 32. Last time you had an alcoholic drink? I despise alcohol. Never touched it yet and don't intend to. 33. What songs do you sing in the shower? Me sing? If any god(s)(ess)(esses) exist, they'd smite. 34. What did you fear was going to get you at night as a child? Fear? I would have welcomed whatever came. 35. What's in your pockets right now? Nothing. 36. Last thing/person that made you laugh? Everything and everyone makes me laugh, which may be a sign of psychosis, neurosis, or simple insanity. 37. Best bed sheets you had as a child? Standard monotone. 38. Worst injury you've ever had? Nothing. I am not active enough to be injured. 40. How many TVs do you have in your house? Four, although I watch no TV. 41. Who is your loudest friend? I have no friends. 42. Who is your most silent friend? See 41. 43. Does someone have a crush on you? Hmm...no...wait, yes. XD 45. What is your favorite book? Watership Down 46. What is your favorite candy? I dislike candy. Sugar bad. 47. What song do you want played at your wedding? Wedding? 48. What song do you want played at your funeral? Nothing. I'd like to have no funeral, the sort of thing unnamed vagrants in big cities get when they die. No sorrow or mourning or recognition or anything, simple disposal and forget. 49. What were you doing at 12 last night? Sleeping, unlike just about everyone else I know. 50. Do you love the pain a tattoo brings? I have no tattos and pain doesn't do much to me either way. As Pops once said, "Pain is just your body's way of telling you you're in terrible agony!"
http://kamikage.livejournal.com/8874.html

HDS discovered something last night that he had not in many moons, something that has that rare ability to make me cheerful, if only for a short while: new Sakuya images.  A small basketfull to be precise.  Wandering imageboards led me to the site of a Japanese artist and the source of a number of images I didn't know the source of earlier, plus the aformentioned new Sakuya.  'Tis nearly all filthy in nature, but I don't care so much.  Any Saku is good Saku. XD

EDIT:  Yet more.  A productive weekend this has been. XD

Yet another thing stolen from Battousai:
HEAVEN LEVEL 2
Raw score: 9%
You scored the highest possible goodness rating on this test! Your intentions are pure and admirable! For you, sex is a spiritual outlet; it is a loving threesome involving you, your partner, and God.

My guess is that you are a Christian. If you're just considering Christianity, great news: you qualify! It is unlikely that your escapades in bed will ever offend God. Unfortunately, they might not excite him either.

For you, sex is second to love, and love is second to faith. Did you know: It was the same for Jesus!

AVOID: Hell Levels 1 and deeper (all hellions).



My test tracked 1 variable How you compared to other people your age and gender:
You scored higher than 0% on hellishness
Link: The Sexual HELL Test written by jason_bateman on OkCupid Free Online Dating, home of the 32-Type Dating Test
HDS suspects this is result stems not from his own inner pervert or lack thereof but rather from the fact that, since all questions are about intercourse and who/what with and under what circumstances, saying no to everything because HDS hates sex itself made him seem much more pure than he actually is. XD
http://kamikage.livejournal.com/8261.html

A second Katsucon has come and gone. Little swag did HDS grab, aside from one delightful Kyo Kara Maoh poster, a few figurines, and some things I must remember to torture Nessles with until her birthday come. Movies and such galore there. Saw Howl's Moving Castle again, as excellent as it was before. Saw Ghost Stories as well, and now I see what Newtype meant when they mentioned its funny dubbing. XD Saw Lupin III: The Colombus File as well. Classic goodness (Albeit classic but made in 1999). Saw a live action Korean horror thing as well, R-Point. Aside from Howl's, it was the best thing I saw there. Crazy hotel, though. The Dealer Room was in the underground parking garage. XD But now I am home and all fleeting glee has past, replaced by aggravation at new and unpleasant developments. A pox upon myself, so that I may die tomorrow.
http://kamikage.livejournal.com/8170.html

It seems like all I say in this thing is that I'm either flying, landing, or going crazy.  Well, this is one of the former.  Back to the air do I take on the 'morrow.  *Hugs his Southwest "A" boarding pass*  To an aisle seat!

Anybody besides me find it hilarious that good 'ole Osama was supposedly offering a truce in a recent tape?  This, to me, is along the lines of President Bush flying to Cuba and givine 'ole Castro a big, sloppy kiss.  Come to think of it, that might not be a bad idea.  Castro'd probably have several acute MI's and expire shortly thereafter.  He'd be dead, and you couldn't accuse Dubya of assassinating him with a mere kiss.  Anybody besides me amused?  I thought not.

And my glasses decided to do their semi-monthly breakup.  Once again the right ear-thingy broke.  Unlike several other times, it did not detach cleanly this time but rather snapped right off.  It has done this before, but only once.  Next time: HDS' glasses burst into flames and consume him, causing him to be reborn as Brigit, Celtic Goddess of Fire.  

Hee!  I spell-checked this and it said "Osama" was not a word. XD  It isn't, but you'd think he'd be in most spell-check databases by now, no?

Registration for Anime Mid Atlantic needs to be done immediately lest I risk a five-dollar (USD) increase in the prereg cost. Hotel roomage as well must be procured. A new counter skin for Okcounter needs to be made, a shrine I've been condiering for some time needs to be started, my tens of thousands of unsorted images need to be sorted...essentially, the usual horid mess.
